paragraphs.name: 24f0
paragraphs.text: But aside from giving you more time to be productive, waking up earlier helps you in a number of other ways. There’s freedom in waking up on your own terms rather than being woken up by an alarm clock. And when you get up earlier, you give yourself a quiet moment to breathe and set your intention for the day.
As Jim Rohn once said, “Either you run the day, or the day runs you.”
paragraphs.name: 8d97
61b8

markups.rel: nofollow noopener noopener noopener nofollow noopener

paragraphs.text: With a million and a half things going on, it’s easy to get distracted when listening to others (especially if it’s a boring topic). However, as uninteresting as the conversation might be, you should know that listening has been called one of the make-or-break factors for successful leadership.

paragraphs.name: 25bd
paragraphs.text: It doesn’t involve thousands of LinkedIn requests or throwing your business card at everyone you meet. The answer is simple: Truly effective networking involves being your authentic, fabulous self, and becoming your own best cheerleader.

paragraphs.name: 61b8

fc38a7669e01.title: The myth of waking up early contributing to success does not hold up to data.

paragraphs.name: de97
paragraphs.text: The myth of waking up early contributing to success does not hold up to data. People who wake up early have the same socio-economic standings as people who go to sleep late. It’s funny how articles that perpetuate this idea seem to only see the positive aspects and miraculously add hours to your day.

paragraphs.text: YES YES YES!! Love this!!!!!!

bd7baf73d9.title: I would add the ability to shift perception.

paragraphs.text: I would add the ability to shift perception. Rather than seeing obstacles, we can choose to see challenges and opportunities to become stronger and better. Rather than seeing what’s wrong, we can see what’s right and what works well. We can focus on gratitude, rather than on grudges. And that is a choice we can make every day. Thank you for the great post, I really enjoyed it.

paragraphs.name: f0c6
paragraphs.text: absolutely true, Elle! So undervalued, I think, because we give so much attention to everyone and everything else throughout the day. When I was first starting to meditate I actually felt a bit strange spending 10 Whole Minutes on nothing but myself :). And yet, as you say, not only is it good for the person, but for everyone in their life. Love your writing, wish you the best!

paragraphs.text: Good points but mindfulness practice does most of this for you already and increases health and well-being in the process.
